Personnaly, I prefer Syslog from www.clarkware.com.  JavaWorld (www.javawor=
ld.com) had an article about best practices for it.

What I like about Sysl=
og (although I have not used Log4J very much) is that I can start logging w=
ith just a line.  The default values are fine for me - Output goes to the c=
onsole.

The only problem I have with that is that the results of the outpu=
t are not mixed with the results of the TestCase.  So, if I have lots of de=
bugging messages, the output is not with the failure.  I have to work a bit=
 to make it fit.  But it's usually paid off by finding another error or two=
 :)

Thanks,
Francois
  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Jason Rogers =

  To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com' 
  Sent: Tuesday, July 03, 2001 9:34 AM
  Su=
bject: RE: [junit] printing my own debug messages


  I looked at that some=
 time ago for some simple logging needs we had, and it
  seemed really heav=
yweight.  Do you disagree?  Do you think it can be scaled
  down pretty eas=
ily?

      > From: Andrew Clarke [mailt=

      > Hi the=
re, 
      > 
      > I've check all the available documentation on whether=
 there is a 
      > possibility to print my own debug output messages from=
 a 
      > test case in 
      > a controlled way - ideally I would like t=
o get them in a 
      > "results.txt" like can be produced by the junit ta=
sk in 
      > ant. It seems 
      > that this is not the way that I'm sup=
posed to go, since 
      > there seems to 
      > be no option for that. =

      > 
      > Nevertheless, it would be nice to use the test case for d=
ebugging 
      > (until it works).
      > It there an option for that? 
 =
     > 
      > Cheers, 
      > 
      > Chris
